title: Oregon pioneered a radical drug policy. Now it's reconsidering.
description: Under Ballot Measure 110, instead of arresting drug users, police give them a citation and point them towards treatment. Over three years in, there's a debate about whether it's succeeded or failed.

title: The U.S. is demanding Iran rein in its proxy groups. Is that actually possible?
description: When the U.S. launched airstrikes over the past week in Iraq, Syria and Yemen, the idea was to send a message to another country: Iran.

title: NPR founding mother Linda Wertheimer is retiring. Read her bittersweet goodbye note
description: "At our first staff meeting there were no chairs (or tables) but there were eager people with lots of plans sitting on the floor and I was one of them," Wertheimer writes.

title: I went hunting for the 14th Amendment, the document that could bar Trump from ballots
description: Come on an adventure inside the research facility holding the Civil War-era document that could bar former President Donald Trump from the White House.

title: Deadly bombings strike Pakistan the day before parliamentary elections
description: There was no immediate claim of responsibility for the explosions in the country's southwest that has killed at least 24.

title: EVs won over early adopters, but mainstream buyers aren't along for the ride yet
description: Sales of electric vehicles were increasing rapidly ... until they weren't. The auto industry is still looking ahead toward an EV future, but worries that moving too fast would hurt the bottom line.

title: The music teacher who just won a Grammy says it belongs to her students
description: Virginia music teacher Annie Ray started an orchestra for students with intellectual and developmental disabilities. She just won a Grammy for music education, and a $10,000 grant for her school.

title: Here's what matters to voters — and what could change their minds if it's Biden-Trump
description: Preserving democracy is top of mind for Democrats and independents, while Republicans are most concerned about immigration. And there are big splits on how to handle immigration in particular.

title: Octopuses are clever. Their fans aren't happy with a plan to farm them for food
description: Octopuses are seen as smart and solitary. A seafood company plans to farm them commercially. Octopus garden? Sure. Octopus farm? No way, say the animal's advocates

title: Venezuela's leftist leader Maduro makes a play for evangelical voters
description: Evangelical Christians are often courted by right-wing politicians. But in Venezuela, left-wing President Nicolás Maduro is trying to secure the church's support in the run-up to elections.

title: 5 MLK speeches you should know. Spoiler: 'I Have a Dream' isn't on the list
description: Martin Luther King Jr.'s iconic 1963 "I Have a Dream" speech is well known, but there are several other key speeches that also resonate as historical signposts of the Civil Rights Movement.

title: 'None of these candidates' takes the Nevada Republican primary, dealing Haley a blow
description: Nikki Haley was the only major candidate left in Nevada's presidential primary election but even that advantage did not help her clinch a win in the contest.
